channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: Harris just showed why Biden chose her as his running mate
How Kamala Harris' Indian roots shaped her political views
item.description: Joe Biden the presumptive Democratic presidential nominee named Kamala Harris as his vice presidential pick, making the California senator the first Black and South Asian American woman to run on a major political party's presidential ticket. Harris was raised by her Indian mother. CNN's Vedika Sud speaks to her extended family in India on how her Indian roots shaped her political views.

item.title: 4 key takeaways from Biden and Harris' first campaign event
CNN Exclusive: Details, title and cover revealed for Bob Woodward's upcoming book on Trump
item.description: First it was fear, now it's rage.

item.title: Last decade was Earth's hottest on record, exposing grim reality of climate change
item.description: A new report released Wednesday details how 2019 was another year of extremes for Earth's climate, adding to a litany of evidence exposing the grim reality of our warming world.

item.title: Belarus authorities arrest 6,000 protesters following disputed presidential election
item.description: Authorities in Belarus say 6,000 people have been arrested and one person has been killed in the violent aftermath that followed longtime President Alexander Lukashenko's reelection, a contest that independent observers have criticized as neither free nor fair.

item.title: Police pull guns on 3 teens after misidentifying suspect
item.description: Three teenagers in Santa Clarita, Ca were held at gunpoint and detained after police mistook them for their alleged attacker.

item.title: Fox News threw everything but the kitchen sink at Kamala Harris
The Republican Senate nightmare is coming true
item.description: At the start of the 2020 election cycle -- way back in December 2018 -- the conventional wisdom was that while Democrats might be able to retake the Senate majority, it was a long shot.

item.title: 'That's spicy': SNL actress reacts to Harris as VP pick
item.description: "Saturday Night Live" actress and comedian Maya Rudolph, who earned an Emmy nomination for her impression of Kamala Harris, reacts to the announcement that Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden selected Harris as his VP pick.

item.title: After TikTok and WeChat, Alibaba could be the next target in Trump's tech war
item.description: The United States has taken aim at some of China's biggest tech champions, from Huawei and ByteDance's TikTok to Tencent's WeChat. Alibaba, one of the world's largest retail and internet conglomerates, could be next.

item.title: More than half of Mumbai's slum residents might have had Covid-19. Here's why herd immunity could still be a long way off
item.description: Last month, researchers in one of India's largest cities made a surprising discovery. Of the nearly 7,000 blood samples taken from people in Mumbai's slums, 57% tested positive for coronavirus antibodies.

item.title: Genome sequence from fresh New Zealand cluster "closely resembles" patterns from UK and Australia
US government slow to act as anti-vaxxers spread lies on social media about coronavirus vaccine
item.description: While anti-vaxxers flood social media with lies about the upcoming coronavirus vaccine -- that it contains monkey brains, that it's a CIA plot to take over the world -- the government's multi-billion-dollar vaccine effort has yet to come up with a public education campaign to counteract that propaganda.

item.title: The Red Bull heir, a crashed car and the scandal that angered Thailand
item.description: Before dawn on September 3, 2012, a roaring black Ferrari struck a police motorcycle in downtown Bangkok, knocking the officer to the ground and dragging his body down the darkened street before speeding away.

item.title: Group of unmasked people take over New York bus and hold party
item.description: Over a dozen people can be seen smoking and drinking during an impromptu party held on a New York City bus in a video confirmed by the Metropolitan Transportation Authority.

item.title: As tensions rise in Asia Pacific, South Korea is building its first aircraft carrier ... complete with US-made fighter jets
item.description: South Korea plans to start building its first aircraft carrier next year, and acquire fighter jets to operate on it, the country's Defense Ministry has announced.

item.title: Wildfires have destroyed more than 60,000 acres across three states and are spreading rapidly
item.description: Firefighters across three states are battling wildfires that have destroyed more than 60,000 acres in the US West.

item.title: Pop star asked senior citizens if they knew her. See what they said
item.description: Singer Dua Lipa interviewed a group of senior citizens while guest-hosting "Jimmy Kimmel Live!" and found out they have no idea who she is.

item.title: Journalists mourn the loss of newsrooms as publishers give up office space to save money
item.description: A version of this article first appeared in the "Reliable Sources" newsletter. You can sign up for free right here.

item.title: Dr. Sanjay Gupta: Why I am not sending my kids back to school
item.description: One of the questions I am getting more than any other: Am I going to send my children back to school? As a father of three teen and preteen girls, this has been a constant discussion in our household, and it hasn't been easy. My girls want to go back to school, and they are placing enormous pressure on us parents to make it so. They miss their friends, the social structure and the immersion in humanity that kids need and crave at this age. Virtual learning has played an important role for them, but it is not a substitute for in-person learning, especially for younger kids. As things stand now, my children are scheduled to start school next week.

item.title: What we know -- and don't know -- about Russia's 'Sputnik V' vaccine
$8 million in drugs seized in largest heroin bust in Georgia's history, officials say
item.description: An Atlanta man has been indicted on federal charges related to the largest heroin bust in Georgia's history, according to officials.

item.title: Huge oil leak is destroying pristine lagoon
item.description: Mauritius is facing an environmental catastrophe after a stricken Japanese-owned ship began leaking oil into the ocean.

item.title: Birds and reptiles cry similar tears to humans, says new research
item.description: Birds and reptiles may not resemble humans in many ways, but they cry similar tears.

item.title: Mother injured in Beirut blast: The night is blood
item.description: Lana Chammas, a mother of two young daughters, was injured in the blast that wrecked Beirut, Lebanon. Adding to her physical injuries, Lana is struggling to process the psychological trauma that her and her family are experiencing. CNN's Arwa Damon reports.

item.title: From Google to garbage disposal: the environmentalist cleaning up India's lakes
item.description: When Arun Krishnamurthy was a teenager, he witnessed a pond near his home in the suburbs of Chennai, India, fill up with trash.

item.title: Japan's first-ever hotel in a wooden castle breathes new life into fading rural town
item.description: A new Japanese hotel is offering travelers a first-of-its-kind experience -- to live like a medieval lord in a real castle keep.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan purchase home in Santa Barbara
item.description: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle have set down roots in Santa Barbara, California.

item.title: Watch SE Cupp's reaction to Biden's vice president pick
item.description: After months of speculation, presumptive Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden revealed that Sen. Kamala Harris (D-CA) will be his running mate. CNN's SE Cupp analyzes the decision.

item.title: Children's theme park employee punched in the face for enforcing park's mask policy
item.description: A teen working at a children's theme park in Pennsylvania was punched in the face for enforcing the park's face mask policy, police say.

item.title: The GOP just took another step toward a dangerous conspiracy theory
item.description: On Wednesday morning, the President of the United States tweeted congratulations to a Republican candidate who won a congressional runoff in Georgia on Tuesday.

item.title: Trump claims dog was sent a ballot. See election official's response
item.description: Colorado has had universal mail-in voting for seven years. George Stern helps oversee elections in Colorado and has invited President Trump to see how it's done. Lucy Kafanov reports.

item.title: 3 men believed to be connected to R. Kelly charged with trying to harass, threaten and bribe alleged victims
item.description: Three men prosecutors say are connected to R. Kelly were charged in federal court for using threats, intimidation and bribes in efforts to influence testimony by alleged victims in the racketeering case against the singer, according to the complaints unsealed Tuesday.

item.title: PSG delivers a stoppage-time stunner to advance to semis
item.description: Paris Saint-Germain scored two late goals to knock Atalanta out of the Champions League, booking its place in the semifinals of the competition.

item.title: Viola Davis proudly 'owns' her story
item.description: Viola Davis gave us all a gift in honor of her 55th birthday.

item.title: Romantic Cartier ad featuring two men stirs censorship debate in China
item.description: A Chinese advertisement for Cartier has reignited discussion about the country's taboo around LGBTQ rights.

item.title: Police find Netherlands' biggest-ever cocaine lab
item.description: Police in the Netherlands have arrested 17 people following a raid on a massive cocaine lab, which they say is the biggest ever found in the country.

item.title: FBI investigates after US military helicopter shot at, injuring a crew member
item.description: A US Air Force helicopter was shot at near Manassas, Virginia, on Monday injuring one of two pilots on board, according to an Air Force official.

item.title: UK crashes into deepest recession of any major economy
Apple, Facebook and Microsoft denounce Trump visa restrictions
item.description: Apple, Facebook and Microsoft are among the 52 companies and organizations in a court filing denouncing Trump administration restrictions on employment-based visas, saying that the action "fundamentally disserves the interests of the United States by stifling the ability of U.S. businesses to attract the world's best talent, drive innovation, and further American economic prosperity."

item.title: Volunteers pick up the pieces as Beirut cries out for help rebuilding
item.description: Volunteer efforts on the ground in Beirut, Lebanon, are filling the void left by the state, which has allocated just $66 million to estimated damage worth $5 billion, according to the government of Beirut. CNN's Ben Wedeman reports.

item.title: Nambia president says Germany's reparation offer for colonial-era mass killings 'not acceptable'
item.description: Namibia President Hage Geingob says his government has turned down Germany's offer of compensation for colonial-era killings, calling it "not acceptable."

item.title: Belarus unrest may torpedo major US diplomatic push to counter Russia
item.description: As Belarus is roiled by a government crackdown on peaceful demonstrators protesting an election condemned by the international community, a casualty of the unrest may be a nascent diplomatic push by the Trump administration to improve ties with Minsk as part of an effort to counter Russia's one-time dominant position there.

item.title: Stephen 'tWitch' Boss breaks silence on working at 'The Ellen DeGeneres Show'
item.description: Stephen "tWitch" Boss, who has been the DJ on "The Ellen DeGeneres Show" since 2014, has addressed allegations from some employees about a toxic work environment at the long-running talk show.

item.title: Gliding past Trump's sexist depictions of her as "mean" and "nasty," the senator from California shredded Trump's White House record
item.description: When Kamala Harris appeared with Joe Biden on Wednesday as his running mate for the first time, she showed why he had chosen her.

item.title: Harris zeroes in on Trump in first campaign event
item.description: Presumptive Democratic nominee Joe Biden and his running mate, California Sen. Kamala Harris, are set to make their first appearance together Wednesday afternoon for a speech in Delaware.

item.title: General election bursts into life in dueling US dreams
item.description: America's choice in November has never been more clear.

item.title: Fox News threw everything but the kitchen sink at Harris
item.description: A version of this article first appeared in the "Reliable Sources" newsletter. You can sign up for free right here.

item.title: Kamala Harris describes moment she got the call from Biden
item.description: Kamala Harris describes the moment she received the call from Joe Biden, the presumptive Democratic presidential nominee, in which he asked her to be his running mate.
